src.construct_models_gurobi package

Submodules

src.construct_models_gurobi.generation_limits_gurobi module

Add generatoin limit constraints

src.construct_models_gurobi.generation_limits_gurobi.MLR_generation_limits(model: Model) → Model[source]

Add MLR generation limits based on Equations (9)–(11) from G. Morales-Espana, J. M. Latorre, and A. Ramos. Tight and compact MILP formulation for the thermal unit commitment problem. IEEE Transactions on Power Systems, 28(4):4897–4908, 2013.

src.construct_models_gurobi.generation_limits_gurobi.pan_guan_gentile_KOW_generation_limits(model: Model) → Model[source]

Add pan_guan_gentile_generation_limits plus the generalized upper bound limits introduced in the text equations (32)–(34)

Call main function to load grid data into parameters of gurobi model without renewable costs

src.construct_models_gurobi.power_balance_gurobi module

Add systemwise power balance variables and constraints to impose the constraints on supply-demand mismatch at each bus level and impose the power flow constraints

src.construct_models_gurobi.power_balance_gurobi.ptdf_power_flow(model: Model, slacks: bool | None = True) → Model[source]

Add constraints to impose the upper bounds on supply-demand mismatch and ensure the power flow balance

src.construct_models_gurobi.power_vars_gurobi module

Add power generated and reactive power generated variables

src.construct_models_gurobi.power_vars_gurobi.garver_power_vars(model: Model) → Model[source]

Add PowerGeneratedAboveMinimum variables, the main variable representing generator output.

Originally proposed in L. L. Garver. Power generation scheduling by integer programming-development of theory. Power Apparatus and Systems, Part III. Transactions of the American Institute of Electrical Engineers, 81(3): 730–734, April 1962. ISSN 0097-2460.

src.construct_models_gurobi.production_costs_gurobi module

Add production cost constraints, piecewise production variables, and production cost variables

src.construct_models_gurobi.production_costs_gurobi.CA_production_costs(model: Model) → Model[source]

Add production costs constraints with additional variables for each piecewise linear segment based on equations (7)–(11) in M. Carrion and J. M. Arroyo. A computationally efficient mixed-integer linear formulation for the thermal unit commitment problem. IEEE Transactions on Power Systems, 21(3):1371–1378, Aug 2006. ISSN 0885-8950. doi: 10.1109/TPWRS.2006.876672.

src.construct_models_gurobi.production_costs_gurobi.KOW_production_costs_tightened(model)[source]

Add production costs constraints based on Ben Knueven, Jim Ostrowski, and Jean-Paul Watson. Exploiting identical generators in unit commitment. IEEE Transactions on Power Systems, 33(4), 2018. Equations (19d)–(19h) with some tightening for when SU != SD

src.construct_models_gurobi.ptdf_utils_gurobi module

Helper functions and classes that are useful when modifying the data dictionary

class src.construct_models_gurobi.ptdf_utils_gurobi.VirtualPTDFMatrix(branches, buses, reference_bus, base_point, ptdf_options, branches_keys=None, buses_keys=None, interfaces=None, contingencies=None)[source]

Bases: _PTDFManagerBase

Helper class which looks like a PTDF matrix, but doesn’t actually calculate/store a PTDF matrix. Keeps a factorization of A^T B_d A instead (or A^T J in internal parlance) and computes flows and needed PTDF rows on-the-fly.

Already calculated PTDF rows are cached for easy retreval on subsequent calls

calculate_LMP(LMPC_Constrs, LMPI_Constrs, LMPE_Constrs)[source]

Calculate a vector of locational marginal prices indexed by buses_keys.

Parameters — LMPC_Constrs, LMPI_Constrs, LMPE_Constrs: Model Constraints Related to different parts of lmp prices

Returns

LMP : np.array of LMPs indexed by buses_keys

calculate_PFV(mb)[source]

Calculate a vector of real power branch flows indexed by branches_keys, a vector of interface flows indexed by interface_keys, and a vector of bus voltage angles indexed by buses_keys, for given ConcreteModel or Block with populated p_nw variable.

Parameters

mb : Gurobipy Model with p_nw attribute indexed by buses

Returns

tuple: (PFV, PFV_I, VA). np.arrays for

real power flow, interface flow, voltage angles.

calculate_PFV_delta(cn, PFV, VA)[source]

Calculate a vector of real power flows indexed by branches_keys, for given contingency cn, for given base-case real power flow and voltage angles given by calculate_PFV

Parameters

cn : contingency name to calculate PFV_delta for PFV : vector of flows returned from calculate_PFV VA : vector of voltage angles returned from calculate_PFV

Returns

PFV_delta: np.arrays for partial contingency flow differences,

such that PFV + PFV_delta is the contingeny flow

calculate_masked_PFV(mb)[source]

Calculate a vector of partial real power flows indexed by branches_masked_keys, a vector of interface flows indexed by interface_keys, and a vector of bus voltage angles indexed by buses_keys, for given ConcreteModel or Block with populated p_nw variable.

Parameters

mbPyomo ConcreteModel or Block with p_nw attribute

indexed by buses

Returns

tuple: PFV, PFV_I, VA. np.arrays for partial

real power flow, interface flow, voltage angles.

calculate_masked_PFV_delta(cn, PFV, VA)[source]

Calculate a vector of partial real power flows indexed by branches_masked_keys, for given contingency cn, for given base-case real power flow and voltage angles given by calculate_masked_PFV

Parameters

cn : contingency name to calculate PFV_delta for PFV : vector of flows returned from calculate_masked_PFV VA : vector of voltage angles returned from calculate_masked_PFV

Returns

PFV_delta: np.arrays for partial contingency flow differences,

such that PFV + PFV_delta is the contingeny flow

returns the maximum of the absolute value for any coefficent in branch_name’s ptdf row

get_branch_ptdf_iterator(branch_name)[source]

returns a (bus_name, coefficient) iterator for a given branch_name

returns the constant coefficient for branch_name ‘s power flow equation (given bus net withdrawls)

returns the maximum of the absolute value for any coefficent in branch_name’s ptdf row

get_contingency_branch_ptdf_iterator(contingency_name, branch_name)[source]

returns a (bus_name, coefficient) iterator for a given branch_name

Returns the maximum of the absolute value for any coefficent in branch_name’s PTDF row

src.construct_models_gurobi.ramping_limits_gurobi module

Add ramping up and down limits

src.construct_models_gurobi.ramping_limits_gurobi.damcikurt_ramping(model: Model) → Model[source]

Add ramping limits based on Equations (3) and (18) from Pelin Damci-Kurt, Simge Kucukyavuz, Deepak Rajan, and Alper Atamturk. A polyhedral study of production ramping. Mathematical Programming, 158(1-2):175–205, 2016.

src.construct_models_gurobi.reserve_requirement_gurobi module

Add reserve constraints and reserve shortfall variables

src.construct_models_gurobi.reserve_requirement_gurobi.CA_reserve_constraints(model: Model) → Model[source]

Add reserve constraints with slacks given by equation (3) in Carrion, M. and Arroyo, J. (2006) A Computationally Efficient Mixed-Integer Liner Formulation for the Thermal Unit Commitment Problem. IEEE Transactions on Power Systems, Vol. 21, No. 3, Aug 2006.

src.construct_models_gurobi.reserve_requirement_gurobi.MLR_reserve_constraints(model: Model) → Model[source]

Add reserve constraints with slacks given by equation (5) in G. Morales-Espana, J. M. Latorre, and A. Ramos. Tight and compact MILP formulation for the thermal unit commitment problem. IEEE Transactions on Power Systems, 28(4):4897–4908, 2013.

src.construct_models_gurobi.reserve_vars_gurobi module

Add maximum power available above minimum variables, reserve provided variables, and generator output limits constraints

src.construct_models_gurobi.reserve_vars_gurobi.MLR_reserve_vars(model: Model) → Model[source]

Add reserves provided variables as in G. Morales-Espana, J. M. Latorre, and A. Ramos. Tight and compact MILP formulation for the thermal unit commitment problem. IEEE Transactions on Power Systems, 28(4):4897–4908, 2013.

src.construct_models_gurobi.reserve_vars_gurobi.check_reserve_requirement(model)[source]
src.construct_models_gurobi.reserve_vars_gurobi.garver_power_avail_vars(model: Model) → Model[source]

Add MaximumPowerAvailableAboveMinimum variables based on the adaption of the idea from the Carrion-Arroyo paper for maximum power available to consider maximum power available over minimum

src.construct_models_gurobi.services_gurobi module

Pseudo functions to add storage services and ancillary services in the future

src.construct_models_gurobi.services_gurobi.ancillary_services(model: Model) → Model[source]

Add ancillary services: regulation, spinning reserve, nonspinning reserve, operational reserve, flexible ramp

src.construct_models_gurobi.services_gurobi.storage_services(model: Model) → Model[source]

src.construct_models_gurobi.startup_costs_gurobi module

Add startup costs constraints and the related variables

src.construct_models_gurobi.startup_costs_gurobi.KOW_startup_costs(model: Model, add_startup_cost_var=True) → Model[source]

Add start up cost constaints based on Ben Knueven, Jim Ostrowski, and Jean-Paul Watson. A novel matching formulation for startup costs in unit commitment, 2017. URL http://www.optimization-online.org/DB_FILE/2017/03/5897.pdf.

src.construct_models_gurobi.startup_costs_gurobi.MLR_startup_costs(model: Model, add_startup_cost_var=True) → Model[source]

Add startup cost constraints based on equations (2)–(3) from G. Morales-Espana, J. M. Latorre, and A. Ramos. Tight and compact MILP formulation for the thermal unit commitment problem. IEEE Transactions on Power Systems, 28(4):4897–4908, 2013.

src.construct_models_gurobi.uptime_downtime_gurobi module

src.construct_models_gurobi.uptime_downtime_gurobi.rajan_takriti_UT_DT(model: Model) → Model[source]

Uptime/downtime constraints (3) and (4) from

D. Rajan and S. Takriti. Minimum up/down polytopes of the unit commitment problem with start-up costs. IBM Res. Rep, 2005.
